org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.activity
Class AeActivityScopeImpl

java.lang.Object
  org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.AeAbstractBpelObject
      org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.activity.AeActivityImpl
          org.activebpel.rt.bpel.impl.activity.AeActivityScopeImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
IAeActivity, IAeActivityParent, IAeBpelObject, IAeCompensatableActivity, IAeExecutableBpelObject, IAeExecutableQueueItem, IAeFunctionFactory, IAeLocatableObject, IAeNamespaceContext, IAeVisitable
Direct Known Subclasses:
AeActivityOnEventScopeImpl, AeBusinessProcess
public class AeActivityScopeImpl
extends AeActivityImpl
implements IAeActivityParent, IAeCompensatableActivity

Implementation of the bpel scope activity.

Method Detail

isSnapshotRecorded

public boolean isSnapshotRecorded()
Returns true if a variable snapshot has been recorded. If this is true, then a subsequent execution of the scope should clone the local variables to ensure that they are different objects than the ones in the snapshot.

setSnapshotRecorded

public void setSnapshotRecorded(boolean aBool)
Setter for the variable snapshot flag

Parameters:
aBool -

alarmCompleted

public void alarmCompleted(AeOnAlarm aAlarm)
                    throws AeBusinessProcessException
Callback from the events container to signal the completion of an alarm. If the child activity for the scope is in a final state then the scope must have been waiting for the completion of the alarm (or some other event) so we'll kick off the disable call again and try to complete the scope.

Parameters:
aAlarm -
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

eventCompleted

public void eventCompleted(AeOnMessage aMessage)
                    throws AeBusinessProcessException
Callback from the events container to signal the completion of an event. If the child activity for the scope is in a final state and there are no active coordinations, then the scope must have been waiting for the completion of the event (or an alarm) so we'll kick off the disable call again and try to complete the scope. Otherwise, we'll requeue the event.

Parameters:
aMessage -
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

isScopeOkToComplete

protected boolean isScopeOkToComplete()
Returns true if the scope's child activity is in a final state and there are no active coordinations

getMessageExchangePath

public java.lang.String getMessageExchangePath(java.lang.String aMessageExchangeValue)
                                        throws AeBusinessProcessException
A messageExchange path is the value of the declaring scope's location path plus /aMessageExchangeValue. This method will check this scope and then continuing walking up the enclosing scopes (including the process) until it finds the scope that declares the messageExchange. This method will never return null since a null indicates a problem with the BPEL process that should have been caught during static analysis.

Parameters:
aMessageExchangeValue -
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

getDef

private AeActivityScopeDef getDef()
Convenience method to avoid having to cast the definition object.

Any method that calls getDef() MUST be overridden in AeBusinessProcess, because the definition object for the process is not an instance of AeActivityScopeDef.

protected AeScopeDef getScopeDef()
Gets the scope definition for this scope.

hasActiveCoordinations

public boolean hasActiveCoordinations()
Returns true if the scope has any activities under 'active' coordination. An activity that has 'completed' is not considered active.

coordinationCompleted

public void coordinationCompleted()
                           throws AeBusinessProcessException
A callback method that signals that all of the scope's active coordinations have completed executing. The scope can now complete.

Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

completeScope

protected void completeScope()
                      throws AeBusinessProcessException
Completing a scope sets its fault handlers to dead path (since they're no longer reachable and shouldn't have been executed) and then completes the events. If there are events currently executing, then the scope will wait for those events to complete.

Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

completeEvents

protected void completeEvents()
                       throws AeBusinessProcessException
If the scope has events then we'll signal the events container that they should be disabled. Otherwise, we'll call the eventsCompleted method which signals the completion of the scope.

Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

addActivity

public void addActivity(IAeActivity aActivity)
Description copied from interface: IAeActivityParent
Adds the activity to this parent. The method implies that there may be more than 1 activity as a child of this parent. This is a side effect of deciding to have a single interface to handle cases with a single child and those with multiple children.

faultHandlerComplete

public void faultHandlerComplete(IAeFault aFault)
                          throws AeBusinessProcessException
Callback method from the fault handler. Indicates that the fault handler completed execution w/o rethrowing a fault. The Scope's state remains at faulted, but its links are still evaluated and regular execution continues.

AeBusinessProcessException

findOrCreateMatchingFaultHandler

private IAeFaultHandler findOrCreateMatchingFaultHandler()
                                                  throws AeBusinessProcessException
Find the matching fault handler by scanning the catch blocks in our definition. If there is no match, then we fall back to the catchAll. If there is no catchAll, then we create the implicit fault handler and return that.

Returns:
IAeBpelObject - the fault handler (will never be null)
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

setAllOtherFaultHandlersToDeadPath

                                         throws AeBusinessProcessException
Sets all of the other fault handlers to dead path except for the one that we matched against and are about to execute.

Parameters:
aMatched -
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException

clearCompInfo

protected void clearCompInfo()
Sets the comp info to null. We clear the reference after we've successfully completed and notified the enclosing scope of our completion. The parent scope is responsible for maintaining our compensation information. This reference is only non-null during the execution of the scope.

public boolean isRecordSnapshotEnabled()

isNormalCompletion

public boolean isNormalCompletion()
Returns true if the scope completed normally. An abnormal completion will prevent the compensation handler from being installed for this execution.

setNormalCompletion

public void setNormalCompletion(boolean aB)
Setter for the normal termination flag. A false value will prevent the compensation handler from being installed for this execution of the scope.

Parameters:
aB -

                                   AeCompInfo aCompInfo)

aCompInfo -

setCompInfo

terminate

public void terminate()
               throws AeBusinessProcessException
Scopes handle terminate calls by generating a bpws:forcedTermination exception and then handling that exception through the regular fault handling process. This will terminate the active child activity as well as any events that have been queued. After the termination completes, the scope will then execute the matched fault handler for the bpws:forcedTermination fault.

Specified by:
terminate in interface IAeExecutableBpelObject
Overrides:
terminate in class AeAbstractBpelObject
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException
See Also:
IAeExecutableBpelObject.terminate()

getChildrenForTermination

public java.util.Iterator getChildrenForTermination()
                                             throws AeBusinessProcessException
Returns the next child available for termination. While Scopes only have a single primary activity, a scope's events (if any) must be terminated when the scope terminated. As such, this method will first return the primary child if it's available for termination and then the event container.

Overrides:
getChildrenForTermination in class AeAbstractBpelObject
Returns:
IAeBpelObject or null if there are no active bpel objects that require termination.
Throws:
AeBusinessProcessException
See Also:
AeAbstractBpelObject.getChildrenForTermination()
